intro: Corymborkis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered corymborkis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. This species is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and its role in local ecosystems.
